name: Format\CollectionDisplay
description: An object used in any container component type to define how the collection of child components is presented.

properties.name: alignment
properties.description: Defines how components are aligned within their rows. This is especially visible when distribution is set to narrow.

properties.name: distribution
properties.description: Describes how components should be distributed horizontally in a row.

properties.name: gutter
properties.description: Either a number in points or a string referring to a supported unit of measure defining the vertical gutter between components.

properties.name: maximumWidth
properties.description: Either a number in points or a string referring to a supported unit of measure defining the maximum width of each child component inside the collection.

properties.name: minimumWidth
properties.description: Either a number in points or a string referring to a supported unit of measure defining the minimum width of each child component inside the collection.

properties.name: rowSpacing
properties.description: Either a number in points or a string referring to a supported unit of measure defining the horizontal spacing between rows. See Specifying Measurements for Components.

properties.name: variableSizing
properties.description: Defines whether the components’ area is allowed to be sized differently per row.

properties.name: widows
properties.description: Defines the approach to prevent the collection from having component widows.
